availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Melvin T. Lowry (Jessamine County, Kentucky, county and circuit court clerk)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Ella E. Daniel Lowry in Jessamine County, Kentucky, on May 1, 1856. Father of Willie D. Lowry, Hiter Lowry, Curd Lowry, and Lulie H. Lowry. Clerk of Jessamine County Court and Jessamine Circuit Court in Jessamine County from 1849 to 1861. Co-owned, with two other persons, twenty-one enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1860.

Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1860, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1861), 355-59.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-08.
Bennett Henderson Young, A History of Jessamine County, Kentucky: From Its Earliest Settlement to 1898 (Louisville: Courier Journal, 1898), 277.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994042, Jessamine County Marriages.
